articles.title: Let's Build A Dungeon is a management game about running a dev studio and designing your own subscription MMO

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Space 4X strategy game Stellaris launched in 2016, but Paradox can't stop adding to the universe. Last time I checked in, it was school trips to other dimensions. Now, it's Cosmic Storms. Due for release alongside the Stellaris 3.13 Vela update on September 10th, these are a paid "mechanical expansion" (priced at a rather chunky £11, $13 or €13, and available as part of the current season pass) that builds upon the game's existing Space Storms, "providing a deeper experience with strategically meaningful gameplay and beautiful upgraded visuals". Wash that down with new civics, precursor narratives, anomalies, archaeology sites, techs, edicts, a new Ascension perk, and new galactic community resolutions.
 Read more
articles.title: Stellaris turns Twister with new Cosmic Storms you can bend to your will

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
If you relished the splashier gunfights of Cyberpunk 2077, like the sound of Doom meets Blade Runner, or wish you could jam your nose right into the neon trenches of Ruiner, you will likely enjoy the announcement trailer for Defect. It's a new "cyberpunk, squad-based, Immersive Objective Shooter" from emptyvessel, a team of erstwhile id Software, Call Of Duty and Naughty Dog folks. 
 Read more
articles.title: Defect is a very loud cyberpunk "immersive shooter" from ex-Call Of Duty, Doom and Naughty Dog devs

articles.author: Kiera Mills
articles.description:
Tiny Glade is a relaxing, wholly escapist building sim where you can kick back and summon villages, cottages and castles whilst listening to whimsical tunes without the worry of combat or busywork. This cosy game has received a lot of attention, becoming the fourth most-played demo during Steam Next Fest and earning a place within our own list of favourite demos. It now has a release date - 23rd September 2024.
Read more
articles.title: Cosy building game Tiny Glade finally has a release date, plus ducks

articles.author: RPS
articles.description:
In the grim heatwave of the midsummer, everyone you know would love to come hunch over a table and roll dice for six hours, actually, but they’ve got that thing on. You remember that thing, right? Plus, no-one’s got a big enough table. Or the new errata. Also, Trevor’s been banging on about lady Custodes for five months straight and nobody wants to be around him right now. Thank the Omni-trevor, then, for the three-player co-op of Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine 2. “Warhammer with the boys?” said Horace as he stretchily dished out preview keys from an entirely different postcode. James, Edwin and Nic were initially all booked-up for the week, but Horace repeated himself, making it absolutely clear that it wasn’t a question.
 
Read more
articles.title: Space Marine 2’s co-op suggests it is in fact jetpacks that make the dream work

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Earlier this week there was some minor Discourse about the removal of the Erotica photography tag from the Dead Rising remaster. Some readers characterised this as a familiar species of cultural hypocrisy regarding video games - emphasising violence is A-OK, but for the love of god, don't mention sex. Good news, those people: Dread XP's latest horror signing The Lacerator has both. It casts you as hirsute 1980s porn star Max - surname not given in press release, but presumably something like Jackin' or Girth - who has been abducted by a large scary individual called the Lacerator.
 Read more
articles.title: In retro gorefest The Lacerator there are as many solutions as you have limbs to lose

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
I was all set to plunge into Blackbird and Gearbox's Homeworld 3 this spring when I received a slightly underwhelmed intergalactic transmission from Nic, praising the game's atmosphere and story while ruminating over fussy controls and a want of tactical depth. Like a herd of frigates scenting a pride of destroyers lurking behind a nearby asteroid, I rerouted hastily and took up a holding position approximately one astronomical unit from the Buy button, hoping that the developers might iron out a few of the wrinkles. 
 Read more
articles.title: Homeworld 3's latest free update and paid DLC probably won't fix its negative Steam reception

articles.author: Ollie Toms
articles.description:
Over 2000 hours spent in various factory games makes me a bit of a purist, I suppose. In theory, I should then be the ideal reviewer to enjoy Shapez 2. But I'm also the ideal reviewer to tear it apart over the most minor hiccups and defects. I'm the Anton Ego of factory games. I don't like food, I love it. If I don't love it, I don't swallow.
Ah, you needn't worry. This is by far the most fun I've had reviewing a game, and Shapez 2 has, in my mind at least, turned the holy trinity of factory games (Factorio, Satisfactory, Dyson Sphere Program) into a holy quartet. Its pared back, everything-is-free-forever approach is quite liberating, and I've never had so much fun placing conveyor belts in my life. But 40 hours into my save file, I've often found myself yearning for a bit more creativity in the challenges, a few more curveballs sent in my direction.
 Read more
articles.title: Shapez 2 early access review: splendid abstract factory-building with room for a few more surprises

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
It’s an oddly Halloweeny summer week for games, this one. Dragon Age: The Veilguard’s October 31st release date leaked earlier, Steam have put together a Summer Fright Night bundle featuring RPS fave Hauntii, and I’ve got a strange urge to gorge on Haribo and mini Double Deckers until blood comes out of my eyeballs. What a perfect time, then, to dive into the alpha demo for vampire management game Blood Bar Tycoon, especially since Two Point seem to be resting on their laurels a bit too comfortably for my liking.
The idea here is you build a swanky bar serving claret cosmopolitans, ichor-ish coffees and uh, viscera vampiros to your undead clientele. But (with the sorta exception of the crimson-sapped Dracaena cinnabari) blood doesn’t grow on trees, so you’ll also be moonlighting as a human-nabber. You’ll research a slew of “whacky contraptions” to extract their blood, which I greatly enjoy, because “zany exsanguination” is a real winner of a feature. You can’t frivolously phlebotomise with impunity, however - you’ll also want to be on the lookout for vampire hunters aka the fun police.
 
Read more
articles.title: I'll serve my Blood Bar Tycoon customers when I'm through dumping exsanguinated bodies down the sewer

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
Put your mortar and pestle down, my herb-smooshing friend. The peasant-quelling RPG antics of Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 won't be releasing this year after all, say developers Warhorse  in a video message to fans. "We aimed for the end of the year, and almost made it," said PR man Tobi Stolz-Zwilling. "Almost is not good enough though, so unfortunately we slipped to 2025."  Never mind, it's easy to slip in the medieval era. There was mud everywhere.
Read more
articles.title: Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 delays its medieval RPG hustling until early next year

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
The release date for Dragon Age: The Veilguard has been revealed in a last-minute leak thanks to a naughty video advertisement. Electronic Arts had planned to share the game's debut-day in about... *checks watchless wrist* ... 7 hours, as part of a special release date trailer. But the internet will ever internet, and thanks to some slip-up or other, we have the knowledge just a smidge early. Will I tell you what the actual release date is? Sure. I guess so.
Read more
articles.title: Oops... the release date for Dragon Age: The Veilguard leaks a few hours early

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Steam’s seeing a good few sweeping changes of late. They’ve recently added a ‘Trending Free’ tab to separate the no money down and no, money down playables. And, as of September, they’re cracking down on links to other websites in store pages. Now, horror of horrors, they’re coming for your ascii gigachads and “nobody is going to read this review so I’ll just say I’m gay” bangers. The changes are part of their ‘New Helpfulness System’, outlined here.
The new system, which will be enabled by default but can be toggled off, aims to “help potential players make informed decisions about the games they are considering purchasing by understanding the attributes of the game that other players like or don't like.” Ah, so a sort of ‘review’, if you will. I like it!
 
Read more
articles.title: Steam’s latest update to user reviews doesn’t find your “jokes, memes, ascii art and other content” as funny as you do

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
The Bullfroggy connected universe that is Two Point County continues to expand with the announcement of Two Point Museum, another irreverent management sim from developers Two Point Studios. This one’s about museums, would you believe, with exhibition themes including the world of prehistory. Find a trailer propped below this paragraph like a freshly brushed-down Tugowaurus skeleton.
 
Read more
articles.title: Two Point Museum announced with trailer full of breakable dinosaurs and reheated cavemen

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
Vroom vroom. That is the sound of 11 rivals revving their engines as they blink the sweat out of their eyes and exhale years of self-doubt from their lungs. Today is their day. We have lined up these racing games on a starting grid and are interested to see how things shake out. Will the realism-obsessed driving sims take the lead with their sublime physics engines? Might the futuristic combat racers simply destroy the opposition with explosive rockets? Or perhaps a nippy arcade crowd-pleaser will soar to the finish line, propelled by the sound of roaring cheers. It's all to play for here at our incredibly messed-up grand prix with a worrying lack of rules or regulation. Start your engines, everyone, these are the 11 best racing games on PC. 3! 2! 1! ... 

 
Read more
articles.title: The 11 best racing games on PC

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
The next advance in video game graphics technology is not ray-tracing or tray-racing or any variation thereof - it's janky stop motion and rubbish plastic dolls, and it actually began about 30 years ago, when I watched the Adam and Joe show for the first time. If you never watched the Adam and Joe show, they used to do home movie recreations of famous films like Titanic and Saving Private Ryan using stuffed animals and action figures. I found these "Toymovies" hysterical as a kid - I suspect they are less so now. Probably, they are full of jokes we might tentatively class as "of their time". The point is, Reptilian Rising is sort of Toymovie: The Game. 
 Read more
articles.title: Reptilian Rising is an enjoyably naff toy-based tactics game featuring Spartacus, St George and Einstein

articles.author: Alice Bell
articles.description:
The Crimson Diamond is a proper old-school style puzzle adventure. It's 2D pixel art, with a limited colour palette as in EGA games, and you control it with a text parser, like King's Quest or one of them other Sierra adventures old men like Graham remember. It's important to mention this up front because it's very possible that, despite The Crimson Diamond's tale of betrayal, murder, and mineral rights in 1914 Canada, the text parser element will be a Rubicon you instantly can't be arsed to cross. A not unreasonable stance - though I think the text parser in The Crimson Diamond is fantastic. Such beef that I have with this adventure game is down to the specificity required to solve some of the puzzles.
Read more
articles.title: The Crimson Diamond review: an enthralling retro-inspired EGA game with modern mystery style

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
KIBORG: Arena feels like a throwback in several ways that I quite enjoy. It’s a free prologue to the upcoming cyberpunk puncher KIBORG. The titular arena is a large room in which you, a large man, bash a large amount of enemies. You have to punch a gong between waves to trigger the next, and this struck me as a nice pre-emptive nudge that every problem you face in Kiborg can be solved by rapidly moving your fist towards offending objects, which turned out not to be too far off the mark.
 
Read more
articles.title: KIBORG: Arena is a free slice of Arkham-style combat starring a John Protagonist-ass punchy cyborg

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Satirical space RPG sequel The Outer Worlds 2 was announced back in 2021. Since then, we've heard nary a peep about it, with developers Obsidian focusing on Pillars Of Eternity successor Avowed and their ace survival game Grounded, which left early access in September 2022. According to Obsidian's studio head Feargus Urquhart, the project is rubbing along nicely. But it was not ever thus: during the opening years of the Covid pandemic, there was apparently "talk of 'do we stop Outer Worlds 2 and just throw the whole team on Avowed'."

 
Read more
articles.title: Outer Worlds 2 is looking "incredible", says Obsidian boss, but they did consider "throwing the whole team on Avowed"

articles.author: James Archer
articles.description:
Valve have made no secret of their plans to make SteamOS – the Linux-based operating system that powers the Steam Deck – available to other games-playing devices, including rival handhelds. After a recent beta update mentioned adding support for the Asus ROG Ally’s inputs, The Verge confirmed with Valve that SteamOS support for non-Steam Deck portables is still very much in the works. The Deck’s long-promised dual booting capability, on the other hand, sounds further down the to-do list.
Read more
articles.title: Valve are still taking SteamOS beyond the Steam Deck, though dual booting is a ways off

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
It’s been looking grim for Super Earth recently. I mean, not really. Multiplayer shooty Helldivers 2 is still sitting around 35,000 concurrent players, which is perfectly respectable, if only around 10% of its peak back in April. Still, a clutch of disgruntled ‘divers have recently found a novel way to protest an increasingly unpopular series of nerfs: laying down their guns and letting the bots take the damn planet.
“If Super Earth wanted to remain safe, they would stop nerfing our guns," reads one comment on the subreddit, in response to a post titled “Let the bots advance. Let the Super Earth burn.” It seems to have picked up some steam inside the actual game, too. As of earlier this week, there’s only around a thousand players actively trying to stop the bots advancing perilously close to the home planet, via Gamesradar.
Whether this is all massively overblown for the sake of a dramatic yarn or not, Arrowhead themselves have taken note of player concerns over nerfs. Yesterday, game director Mikael Eriksson unveiled a plan for the next 60 days, directly addressing player feedback over the controversial ‘Escalation of Freedom’ update.
 
Read more
articles.title: Arrowhead emerge with a bullet-pointed peace offering to pacify mutinous Helldivers 2 players

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Finding and sharing Free Stuff is one of the time-honoured duties of the video game journalist or SEO-monger. Back when I was OXM's online editor, "free Xbox games" was one of our golden Google pillars, the other two being "Minecraft Xbox 360 update" and "Skyrim something something". Well, uncle Valve has just rudely torpedoed that ancient investigative initiative by adding a Trending Free tab to the Steam frontpage, encompassing prologues, demos, free-to-play games and that most treasured of jewels, a full free game with no monetisation elements, such as Grimhook.
Do not cry for us pitiful electronic scribblers, crowded on our melting internet icebergs. Play free games instead! Thanks to that new tab, I've just discovered a demo for neato wide-format tower defender Frontline Crisis. Hah, that'll keep the awareness of steady livelihood erosion at bay.
 Read more
articles.title: Steam now has a Trending Free tab for demos, full free games and free-to-play

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Aside from being a game where you run around a shopping mall murdering the living dead, the original Dead Rising from 2006 is a clownish satire of sleazy tabloid photojournalism. It expresses this by way of its scoring system, where you earn "Prestige points" for snapping pictures that fit one of five categories: "Brutal" scenes of characters being slain; moments of "Horror", such as the spectacle of an approaching horde; comical "Outtakes", like characters caught in bizarre poses; moments of "Drama", such as people reacting to discoveries; and "Erotic" photos of women alive or undead, which range from snaps of exposed underwear to close-ups of cleavage.
The Erotica tag has, however, been chopped from the Dead Rising Deluxe Remaster, in what Capcom gingerly suggest isn't "a response to a changing cultural climate", but expressive of the view that earning points from such photos is not "an appropriate reward for survival and not a skill required of a journalist trying to stay alive".
 Read more
articles.title: The Dead Rising remaster no longer gives you points for "Erotica" creepshots because it's not "required" or "appropriate"

articles.author: James Archer
articles.description:
The Steam Deck’s competitors, whether they’re the old guard Ayaneo family, the luxe Asus ROG Ally X, or the shapeshifting Lenovo Legion Go, usually share the same attack line: they can play more of your games. The Deck’s compatibility issues aren’t nearly as issue-some as they were at launch, but between its Linux-based SteamOS and its relatively mild processing power, but it is true that beefier Windows handhelds will more likely cater to your entire cross-launcher library.
Unless, that is, you get something else to run them for you. Streaming games on the Steam Deck has emerged as a nifty workaround for the portable PC’s lingering compatibility woes, making even officially unsupported games playable. Usually with much better performance, too, as the actual rendering work is done remotely – what you see on the Deck’s screen is basically a video feed of that remote device’s display output, with your control input beamed the other way via a low-latency connection. And because you’re not using SteamOS or the internal hardware to actually run the game, it’s not bound by their limits.
Read more
articles.title: Even with some annoyances, game streaming can feel like a Steam Deck cheat code

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
I'm no shoot 'em up nutter - or "shmutter", as I understand they prefer to be called - but some of the first games I remember playing are shmups. Games like Maelstrom, Ambrosia's Macintosh clone of Asteroids, and the proto-shmup Crystal Quest from Patrick Buckland, who would go on to make Carmageddon. Little did I know that the humble premise of a small 2D spacecraft shooting baddies on a wrap-around screen would reach the glittering heights of Nova Drift. Had you shown me this game back in 1995, I dare say I'd have shmupped myself.
 
Read more
articles.title: Arcade shooter Nova Drift is a Petri dish in which to spawn the daftest, deadliest spaceship

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
The survivors in the upcoming Dead Rising Deluxe Remaster - itself an update of the 2016 HD version of the 2006 zombie open-mall action game - are still idiots. I’m starting to regret giving Burt a gun, honestly. Every time he bumps into a magazine rack he starts screaming like someone’s eating his face, and the little circle above his name turns red to indicate he’s in danger. That’s a mannequin, Burt. They can’t hurt you. They’re actually known for not being able to move.
 
Read more
articles.title: Dead Rising Deluxe Remaster’s survivors are still idiots, but at least they can die horribly in style now

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
As long-time readers will know, I'm a piteous mark for weird little game guys. I’m currently trying to puzzle out what the titular Mother Machine in The Curious Expedition studio Maschinen-Mensch’s upcoming co-op platformer refers to. But, if it’s a reference to forming a parental bond with what the game has saw-me-comingishly named “chaos gremlins”, I'm way ahead of you.
Ah, the press release speaketh! Probably should have read some more before I began exclaiming “Chaos Gremlins!” over and over. Have an announcement trailer.
Read more
articles.title: The Curious Expedition studio’s next game Mother Machine lets you co-op as emotional support chaos gremlins created by a lonely supercomputer

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Among the many, Gigery beauties of 2014's Alien: Isolation is that you save using an in-game, wall-mounted Emergency Phone - a maddeningly analog process of slotting a keycard into the machine and waiting for three beeps. Doing this requires you to stand upright in full view, with your back turned upon an entire space station's worth of shiny domed technology and guttural industrial noises. Delightful!
Amongst the players harrowed and compelled by this fixture is Fede Álvarez, director of the 2013 Evil Dead remake, 2016's Don't Breathe and, most recently Alien: Romulus - the seventh and avowedly "back to basics" Alien movie. Isolation is the Alien experience that convinced Álvarez the Alien could still be scary, after decades of milking the creature's dugs for spin-off movies and making it share a screen with the Predator, the Pepsi Max to Alien's Dom Pérignon 1921. In possibly self-defeating homage to Creative Assembly's work, he's filled the movie with Emergency Telephones, turning them into a straightforward-sounding form of foreshadowing.
 Read more
articles.title: Alien: Romulus has turned Alien: Isolation's savegame mechanic into a way of spoiling its own scares

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
Everyone loved Half-Life yet no one in 1998 was brave enough to say: "Okay, but what if this was an early access crafting survival game voiced by a bunch of New Zealanders?" Those 90s cowards. Abiotic Factor is the courageous game that has been correcting this historic oversight. It's fun, and the fun just got funnerer. The "Crush Depth" update, released yesterday, adds a heap of new areas to the game's messed-up scientific facility, including a dangerous Security Sector and a vast reservoir zone called the Hydroplant. On top of that there are new weapons, tools, workbenches, drivable vehicles, fishing rods, and quite a bit more. It's all shown off in the trailer below.
Read more
articles.title: Abiotic Factor's biggest update yet adds new sectors to explore, plus jetpacks, jeeps and laser katanas

articles.author: Ed Thorn
articles.description:
Are you a prospective buyer of Black Myth Wukong and would like to see if your PC qualifies for uninterrupted monkeying around? Wowee, would you look at that! There's a BMW (no, not the German multinational manufacturer of vehicles) benchmarking tool out now that lets you preview how the game would run on your hardware.
Read more
articles.title: Black Myth Wukong's benchmarking tool lets you test your rig's capacity for monkeying around

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Valve's third-person hero shooter Deadlock hasn't been officially revealed yet, but thousands of you unscrupulous devils have been playing it thanks to stolen development builds. Speculation abounds that these "leaks", coupled with Valve's obstinate silence about it, are a calculated publisher psyop. Are they deliberately letting people play the game early so as to temper the marketing rollout in some way? Perhaps handle any initial player criticism under cover of non-announcement? It seems unlikely, but as other writers have pointed out, this is Valve, unaccountable elder god of PC gaming. I guess we should be thankful it isn't another Half-Life tease.
 Read more
articles.title: Thousands are playing Valve's unrevealed shooter Deadlock, a blend of Team Fortress 2 and Dota with Bioshocky skyrails

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Update: The PlayStation Store's description has now been changed to omit the part quoted below. Being a forward-thinking individual, however, I took a screenshot. 
Well, root my toots. Unless you’re Australian, in which case don't do that. Just enjoy the now very much confirmed-looking release of the original Red Dead Redemption on PC. That’s according to a listing on the PlayStation Store, which contains the currently inaccurate but tantalising phrase “now on PC for the first time ever.”
 
Read more
articles.title: Playstation Store lists Red Dead Redemption as “now on PC for the first time ever”

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
In Shadows Of Doubt you can fall from the roof of a corporate office building during a routine investigation, shatter all the bones in your frail detective body, wake up in a clinic fully healed, and then sprint out the door without paying your sky-high hospital bills while the clinic's auto-turret shoots at you for doing a medical dine and dash. The early access game is on our best immersive sims list for a reason, you know, and now it has an autumn release date for the final version, along with a new trailer.
Read more
articles.title: Shadows Of Doubt emerges from the wet alleyway of early access with 1.0 release next month

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
Last week, Bethesda released a remastered edition of Doom and Doom II on Steam, with lots of extra episodes and improvements. One of these new features is a built-in browser for mods, and support for many existing mods that previously required a different version of the game. Basically, lots of good fan-made mods are now playable on the Steam version of ye olde Doom. That's neat! Ah, but there is some demon excrement on the health pack, so to speak. The mod browser lacks moderation and lets people upload the work of others with their own name pinned as the author. That's prompted one level designer to call it "a massive breach of trust and violation of norms the Doom community has done its best to hold to for those 30 years." 
Read more
articles.title: Doom modders are annoyed at the "chum-bucket" of wrongly credited mods in the latest Doom remaster

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Conan Throwbrien welcomes its host to the stage with discordant jazz and uncanny colour bars glitches. It feels eerie. Desperate. A crushing inevitability. Four joke topics appear at the bottom of the screen. Ridiculous celebrity kids names. Action figures for news anchors. Diet water sales boom. You cautiously slide that last one over to the microphone. Throwbrien emits a string of chirps, like a flame-crested lyre bird with a wounded voicebox trying to mimic human language. “Have you folks heard about this one…”
There is an implied terror in this seemingly friendly opener. What if they have heard this one? What will Throwbrien do then?
 
Read more
articles.title: Become an aging court jester trapped in a cyclical hell at the whims of a fickle audience in Conan Throwbrien

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Tango Gameworks are back from the dead. The Hi-Fi Rush studio have been acquired - alongside the IP for future games in the rhythm action series - by South Korean company Krafton, who also own PUBG Studios and Striking Distance, among others. “This strategic move will include the rights to Tango Gameworks’ acclaimed IP, Hi-Fi Rush,” Krafton said in a statement today. I particularly enjoy the hand-rubbing, grinning use of the word ‘strategic’ here. Great news though.
Read more
articles.title: PUBG owner Krafton have acquired Tango Gameworks and the Hi-Fi Rush IP

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
There are times when I think each week's most intriguing new PC releases are being organised behind the scenes by a fiendishly plotting, Left 4 Dead-style "AI Director". Mostly, the games approach in small groups distributed evenly among the weekdays - a steady assault. But every now and then, they treacherously mass and pounce on one particular day. This week, it's the latter.
 Read more
articles.title: The Maw: what's new in PC games this week?

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Hello reader who is also a reader, and welcome back to Booked For The Week - our regular Sunday chat with a selection of cool industry folks about books! This week, I’ve been half reading in the garden and half staring in awe at my Kindle’s paperwhite doohickey and it’s ability to stay readable in searing sunbeams. I’m tempted to look up how it works but I don’t want to find out it’s made from the luminous, genetically-engineered husks of the workers that drop dead from dehydration at the fulfilment centers or something. To help distract me with yet more books, it’s Dishonored: Death Of The Outsider writer and Destiny 2 senior narrative designer, Dr. Hazel Monforton! Cheers Hazel! Mind if we have a nose at your bookshelf?
Read more
articles.title: What's on your bookshelf?: Destiny 2 and Dishonored narrative designer Hazel Monforton

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Sundays are for more Gene Wolfe. I’ve finished Shadow Of The Torturer now, and I think Claw Of The Conciliator might be even better so far? Before I become ever more enamoured with Severian’s self-mythologising antics, let’s read this week’s best writing about games (and game related things!)
Read more
articles.title: The Sunday Papers

articles.author: Ollie Toms
articles.description:
The search for the cheapest and yet best quality supermarket drink-as-you-go coffee continues. I know it's the first time I've made you aware of this project, but it's been going on since I moved to Glasgow. So far, Lidl's own brand remains the clear winner, a solid 8 on the taste meter at just 59p. But while writing this, I'm sipping an "Intenso" Arctic Coffee from Morrisons, which is giving the Lidl frontrunners some stiff competition at last, albeit at 145% the cost. Will one true victor emerge? Find out next week! For now, here's what we're all clicking on this weekend!
 Read more
articles.title: What are we all playing this weekend?

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Sometimes I want to play a video game, and sometimes I just want to assemble a quiet little Dutch town with iron bridges, fountains and dinky trams bustling about like bumble bees. The project in question is Tramstertram. Aside from being a terrifying feat of punmanship, it's a browser-based building toy from Matt Stark, creator of the really rather lovely Viewfinder.
Read more
articles.title: Here's a free miniature town-builder with trams from the creator of Viewfinder

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
The weekend bears down on us like a host of hissing, barrel-throwing psychics, but there is yet time for some brief updates on Remedy's Control 2, which Remedy say is coming along nicely. The same is apparently true of the multiplayer Control spin-off Project Condor and the Max Payne 1 & 2 remakes, on which Remedy are collaborating with GTA and Max Payne 3 developers Rockstar.
 Read more
articles.title: Control 2, Condor and the Max Payne remakes are shaping up just fine, say Remedy

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
When I zoom the camera on Alex's momentarily untensed face while he's dozing by the pool, it's not because I'm a creep. When I pursue Ayo and Dija around the garden, keeping their feet and butts in shot as they belittle each other, it's not because I'm a busybody and a lech. And when I pan to the lighthouse piercing the sunset beyond the security spikes it's not out of any feeling of wonder, or even curiosity about possible escape routes. Please understand: I do not see these people, these objects at all, just the boneless, faceless traces they leave upon my own servitude to the lens. 
 
Read more
articles.title: The Crush House review: sassiety of the spectacle

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
The first Splitgate was a cracker mash-up of Halo multiplayer gunfights and Portal's nifty spacetime windows. It was a gimmick that made flanking fun again, at least until you died to a distant rifle that was right next to you all along. Its sequel, Splitgate 2 is continuing that gimmick but is also sprucing up the free-to-play arena shooter with a few modern additions, like bum-sliding around corners and big deployable bubbles called "time domes" that slow down your enemies yet speed up your allies. All this and more comes from a gameplay trailer that went up yesterday.
Read more
articles.title: Splitgate 2 will add bum slides and time-altering bubbles to its portal-hopping shootsing

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
The new God Of War duology has my favourite snow in gaming. I can take or leave about 60% of everything else in them, but lawdy, that snow! In God Of War Ragnarok, the action kicks off a during the apocalyptic fimbulwinter, which is probably bad for some characters I don’t care about, but it is good for me personally, because there’s a lot of snow to play with.
How much snow, you ask? 190 flippin’ gigs worth, apparently, according to Sony’s system requirements.
Read more
articles.title: I hope you've got a spare 190GB kicking about for God Of War Ragnarok on PC

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Yesterday, Nic took James and I on a tour of Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine 2's co-op campaign. A merry old time was had, romping through fortress cities like a small herd of crusader buffalo, using the game's absurd jetpack functionality to pancake invading Tyranids, and getting our screens so slathered in gore we couldn't work out who was killing what.
It looks like the gargantuan action game's PvP multiplayer will be even messier. Saber and Focus Home have released an extended trailer that walks you through two major modes - the PvE boss and wave-slaying frenzy of Operations, and the 12-player PvP carnage of Eternal War, which spans a range of match types. The ecstasy of dying for the Emperor aside, both give me frightful flashbacks to the early days of Gears Of War.
 Read more
articles.title: Warhammer 40k: Space Marine 2 PvP multiplayer certainly has that old timey Gears Of War energy

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Shapez 2 will launch in Early Access on August 15th, bringing the relaxing, shape-cutting factory builder into 3D.

In a new post, its lead developer has laid out what to expect from Early Access. In the main: a polished, 40 hours-or-so experience with no known major issues, and a post-release roadmap waiting to be defined by player feedback.

 
Read more
articles.title: Shapez 2's Early Access should run smoothly with factories 12x bigger than the first game

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Did The Gentlebros come up with the pun "Pi-Rats" and then work backwards from there in deciding that Cat Quest 3 should be pirate themed? Or was "Purr-ibean" the initiating pun? I feel that the action-RPG sequel had to begin with one of wordplay or another, given that its Steam page boasts that it also has "furr-ocious spells" and "gla-meow-rous costumes".

It's also claws-out now on Steam, which has me feline fine.

 
Read more
articles.title: Cat Quest 3's pun-soaked animal pirate action-RPG is out on Steam now

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Ondřej Caletka)
articles.description: Nejnovější verze OpenSSH automaticky blokuje hádání hesel. Funkce je navíc automaticky zapnutá. V článku se podíváme na to, jak přesně blokování funguje, jak se dá jeho chování nastavit a zda automatická aktivace nové funkce může představovat problém.
articles.title: OpenSSH má vlastní obranu proti hádání hesel. Jak přesně funguje?

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jiří Sluka)
articles.description: Pravidelná středeční sonda do světa software. Dnes se podíváme na zrobustněné Malování, necháme si vygenerovat titulky z videa a nakonec vyzkoušíme GUI pro emulátory služeb z Google Cloud Platform.
articles.title: Softwarová sklizeň (21. 8. 2024): vylepšené Malování s umělou inteligencí

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Pavel Tišnovský)
articles.description: Dnes si popíšeme pokročilejší grafické operace podporované kartou VGA, které dokáží ušetřit práci CPU. Jedná se o horizontální i vertikální scrolling, podporu pro double i tripple buffering a taktéž o režim rozdělené obrazovky.
articles.title: Grafické operace přímo podporované čipy karty VGA

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: ČD - Telematika)
articles.description: Dnes se podíváme na nově vydané šifrovací standardy NIST, statistiky DDoS útoků za první pololetí roku 2024, potenciální kyberšpionáž v Rusku a zranitelnosti v produktech od Microsoftu.
articles.title: Postřehy z bezpečnosti: kvantové šifrování, rekordní DDoS útoky a nové zranitelnosti

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Filip Zatloukal)
articles.description: Redox OS představil nový webový server a schopnost vytvářet binární soubory. Vývojáři Debianu vylepšují a zrychlují správce balíčků APT. Vydání Ubuntu 24.04.1 LTS muselo být odloženo kvůli objevení řady chyb.
articles.title: Redox OS má webový server, Debian vylepšuje APT

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Podpora AMD Smart Data Cache Injection, KDE a správa barev na Waylandu, Ubuntu s X.Org v samostatném balíčku, TI postaví továrny za miliardy,
articles.title: Kim Dotcom bude vydán do USA, herní engine Godot s podporou Waylandu

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Desítky dílčích testů ilustrují jedno: AMD s novým Ryzenem 9 9950X opět odskakuje Intelu i sama sobě a posouvá hranice možného o notný kus vpřed. Podívejme se na celý velký test v souvislostech.
articles.title: AMD Ryzen 9 9950X: test potvrdil nového krále PC světa

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Lukáš Kotek)
articles.description: Provozovat FreeDOS ve virtuálním stroji už umíme. Následující text popisuje retro notebook Pocket 386, zprovoznění FreeDOSu na něm a množství drobných tipů a triků nejen ohledně české lokalizace.
articles.title: Pocket 386: FreeDOS na malém notebooku se spoustou konektorů

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Pavel Tišnovský)
articles.description: Na článek, v němž jsme se zabývali základní problematikou modelů provádějících klasifikaci dat, dnes navážeme. Ukážeme si jeden z modelů, jenž namísto klasifikace provádí regresi. Jedná se o model lineární regresní analýzy.
articles.title: Balíček scikit-learn: modely provádějící regresní analýzu

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Filip Zatloukal)
articles.description: Sonda do světa otevřeného softwaru. Dnes si představíme aplikaci pro vyhledávání obsahu souborů, vyzkoušíme kalkulačku z Windows na Linuxu, řekneme si o novém webovém prohlížeči a zazálohujeme si systém.
articles.title: Softwarová sklizeň (14. 8. 2024): hledejte v obsahu svých souborů

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Grafické karty od Nvidie mají k dispozici zbrusu nový ovladač verze 560.35.03, u nějž Nvidia přechází na open-source jaderný základ ovladače, a to u generací GPU, pro které tento základ vyvíjí (starší nadále poběží s původním uzavřeným modulem). Na desktopu jsou tak i nadále podporovány grafické karty od GeForce GTX 750 (Ti) výše, notebookové od řady GeForce 800M výše.
articles.title: Vydán ovladač Nvidia 560 přecházející na otevřený základ

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Další nová verze CPU kodéru SVT-AV1 a další zrychlení. SVT-AV1 2.2 přináší další optimalizace parametrů kódování, které vedou k v průměru 15% zrychlení běhu s profily M0 až M8 při zachování téměř shodné vizuální kvality výstupu.
articles.title: Nová verze AV1 kodéru SVT-AV1 2.2 je o 15 % rychlejší

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Vývojáři GIMPu oznámili na X/Twitteru přechod do stádia String Freeze. Budoucí verze 3.0 tak má jasné textové popisy, které budou postupně dopřekládány do spousty jazyků a už se s nimi nebude hýbat. GIMP 3.0 je tak o krůček blíže vydání.
articles.title: Budoucí GIMP 3.0 má za sebou String Freeze, vydání zase o krok blíže

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Už jen posledních deset dní zbývá na přihlašování přednášek na letošní konferenci LinuxDays. Organizátory zajímají především témata týkající se Linuxu, open source, sítí, bezpečnosti, vývoje a podobně. Mezi návštěvníky jsou jak začátečníci, tak i velmi zkušení odborníci. Nemusíte se tedy bát přidat své téma.
articles.title: Posledních deset dnů pro přihlášení přednášky na LinuxDays 2024

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: jafaktnevim)
articles.description: Společnost Firaxis Games představila novou strategickou hru Civilization VII, která posouvá grafickou stránku a herní možnosti opět na vyšší úroveň. Města jsou fantastická, bitvy propracované. Lodě mohou nově plout i na řekách. Hudba úžasná. Uvidíme, co dalšího nám Civ VII přinese.
articles.title: Představená hra Civilization VII má slíbenou linuxovou podporu

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Daniel Van Vugt z Canonicalu, jeden z předních vývojářů desktopu GNOME, pokračuje s řadou zajímavých patchů zasílaných do jádra. Předně se sluší zmínit, že tripple-buffering ještě nestihl projít kontrolou, a tak spíše lze očekávat, že do GNOME 47 to nestihne.
articles.title: Canonical / Ubuntu znovu zprovozňuje EGL pro Nvidii na Waylandu

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Jan Grulich z Red Hatu zapracoval na podpoře běhu webových kamerek ve Firefoxu přes rozhraní PipeWire. Novinka si v rámci Red Hatího světa odbude premiéru s vydáním Fedory 41 v říjnu tohoto roku, kde bude PipeWire pro Firefox při obsluze webových kamerek výchozím rozhraním. A jak dodává Phoronix, práce je součástí širší snahy o přechod na PipeWire, plus implementaci podpory nové generace webkamerek s rozhraním Intel IPU6, což je mimo jiné práce Hanse de Goedeho.
articles.title: Fedora 41 bude pro webkameru ve Firefoxu používat PipeWire, finišuje podpora i pro Chromium

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Z pravidelného čtvrtletního reportu o novinkách v projektu FreeBSD plyne, že se hýbou ledy v oblasti AMD a oblíbený systém, který ostatně pohání Playstationy 4 a 5 s CPU/GPU AMD, by měl dostat lepší podporu. Kromě toho vývojáři FreeBSD pracují na spoustě dalších front, od OpenZFS, přes zvukový subsystém, portování Vector Packet Processoru (VPP) až po různá API.
articles.title: Spolupráce AMD a FreeBSD pro více než 256 CPU jader

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: O open source strategii v reálném čase Beyond All Reason (BAR) jsme tu před dvěma roky psali.  Je inspirovaná hrou Total Anihiliation z roku 1997.
articles.title: Open source RTS Beyond All Reason má nový trailer

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Zajímá vás moderní přístup ke službám a témata jako Docker, kontejnery, cloud, virtualizace a Kubernetes? Připravili jsme pro vás čtyřdenní kurz Docker s Kubernetes, na který můžete získat dotaci až 82 % od Úřadu práce. Kontaktujte naši kolegyni pavla.hettnerova@iinfo.cz.
articles.title: Čtyřdenní kurz Docker s Kubernetes dotovaný Úřadem práce

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Dnes vyšlo Raspberry Pi 5 s 2 GB RAM. Jde o levnější variantu již prodávaných Raspberry Pi 5 s 4 a 8 GB RAM. Jednak se ušetřilo na menší paměti a také použitý SoC Broadcom BCM2712 má nový stepping D0. Funkčně je shodný s předchozím BCM2712, jen byl vynechán nepoužívaný křemík, čímž se také ušetřilo.
articles.title: Levnější Raspberry Pi 5 s 2 GB RAM

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Windows 11 Build 27686, který se dostal minulý čtvrtek do Insider kanálů, bude schopen formátovat oddíly FAT32  větší než 32 GB. Zatím tedy jen z příkazové řádky.
articles.title: Windows 11 budou nově moci formátovat FAT32 větší než 32 GB

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Ibrahim Al-Nasser ze Saúdské Arábie má Guinnessův rekord v co největším počtu herních konzolí připojených k jedinému televizoru. Připojeno jich bylo 444. Přitom použil více než 12 HDMI přepínačů a přes 30 cinch přepínačů pro starší konzole. Zatímco HDMI přepínače se automaticky propojí, stačí jen zapnout konzoli, s přepínáním cinchů je to složitější.
articles.title: Guinnessův rekord: 444 herních konzolí připojených k jedinému televizoru

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Klasickou RPG Diablo včetně rozšíření Hellfire je možné hrát v prohlížeči díky projektu Diabloweb. Ten je založen na starším projektu Devilution.
articles.title: Diablo je možné hrát v prohlížeči

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Bývalí vývojáři Blizzardu vytvořili strategii v reálném čase Stormgate. Ta je nyní na Steamu v předběžném přístupu zdarma. Je sice jen pro Windows, ale podle všeho funguje dobře v Linuxu s Protonem 9.0–2.
articles.title: Bývalí vývojáři Blizzardu vytvořili RTS Stormgate, je v předběžném přístupu zdarma

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Uzavřený populární multiplatformní benchmark Geekbench pro Linux, macOS, Windows, Android a iOS patrně znáte. V roce 2013 se o něm nelichotivě vyjadřoval i Linus Torvalds. Nově byl včera vydán Geekbench AI 1.0, který testuje výkon pro zátěže typu umělé inteligence a strojového učení. Pro macOS, Linux a Windows jsou na oficiální stránce. Pro iOS a Android v obchodě s aplikacemi.
articles.title: Geekbench AI testuje rychlost vašeho počítače či telefonu pro AI

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: První opravné vydání Ubuntu 24.04.1 LTS mělo podle plánu vyjít již tento týden. Objevilo se však pět závažných chyby v aktualizačním procesu a proto bude vydání opožděno o dva týdny.
articles.title: Ubuntu 24.04.1 LTS vyjde až koncem měsíce

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Chcete se stát datovým analytikem s přesahem do datového inženýrství a v budoucnu se věnovat třeba i strojovému učení či AI? Pak je tu pro vás půlroční intenzivní kurz Datový analytik s Pythonem, kterým vás jednou týdně ve 24 lekcích provedou zkušení lektoři s komerční praxí.
articles.title: Staňte se datovým analytikem s Pythonem (školení)

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Chcete se stát odborníky na monitoring pomocí systému Zabbix? Nabízíme pětidenní kurz Zabbix, který probíhá online a je zaměřen na řešení praktických problémů. Kurz je dotován Úřadem práce, od kterého můžete získat až 82 % ceny kurzu. Kontaktujte naši kolegyni pavla.hettnerova@iinfo.cz.
articles.title: Pětidenní kurz Zabbix dotovaný Úřadem práce

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Společnost Intel prodala během druhého čtvrtletí celý svůj podíl ve společnosti Arm Holdings, jak vyplývá z úterní zprávy pro americkou Komisi pro cenné papíry. Společnost rovněž prodala svůj podíl ve společnosti ZeroFox, která se zabývá kybernetickou bezpečností, a snížila podíl ve společnosti Astera Labs, která vyvíjí platformy pro připojení firem.
articles.title: Intel prodal podíl ve společnosti Arm přibližně za 147 milionů dolarů

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Americký Národní institut pro standardy a technologie (NIST) dnes zveřejnil dlouho očekávané standardy postkvantového šifrování, které mají chránit elektronické informace do vzdálené budoucnosti, kdy se dá očekávat, že kvantové počítače prolomí stávající kryptografické algoritmy. Už dlouho se hovoří o tom, že by takové stroje mohly být k dispozici za deset let.
articles.title: NIST dokončil trojici standardů postkvantového šifrování

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Distribuce Gentoo byla jednou z posledních linuxových distribucí, která stále ještě udržovala podporu pro architekturu Itanium (IA-64). Podpora v linuxovém světě ale postupně mizí na mnoha úrovních včetně jádra operačního systému nebo překladače GCC. Nyní i vývojáři Gentoo oznámili konec.
articles.title: Gentoo ukončuje podporu architektury Itanium IA-64

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Tři roky po původním vydání končí pravidelná bezpečnostní podpora Debianu 11 s kódovým označením Bullseye. Tým dlouhodobé podpory Debianu (LTS) převzal bezpečnostní podporu od týmů pro bezpečnost a pro vydání. Bullseye LTS bude podporován od 15. srpna 2024 do 31. srpna 2026.
articles.title: Bezpečnostní podpora pro Debian Bullseye předána týmu LTS

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Až 256 procesorových jader typu RISC-V nabídne nově ohlášená produktová řada P870-D od SiFive. Cílí pochopitelně na datacentra či obecně serverové využití. Vedle obvyklé výbavy SiFive hovoří explicitně o podpoře pro AI/HPC či podpoře CXL (Compute Express Link) a CHI chip to chip (C2C).
articles.title: SiFive ohlašuje 256jádrový RISC-V procesor P870-D, dostupnost ještě v roce 2024

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Na Open-Source Firmware Conference (OSFC) konané v německé Bochumi 3. až 5. září tohoto roku bude přítomna i AMD a dozvíme se nové detaily k dlouhodobým firemním plánům kolem open-source firmwarů. Řeč tedy bude o běžícím projektu openSIL, který jednoho dne nahradí dosud používaný systém AGESA.
articles.title: AMD podrobněji k openSIL začátkem září na konferenci

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: V letních měsících byly vydány aktualizace openSUSE Leap a SUSE, FreeBSD, Debianu, na testování zabezpečení zaměřených distribucí Kali a Parrot, dále např. IPFire, EasyOS, Tails či EndeavourOS.
articles.title: Distribuční novinky 23-26/2024

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: AI působí jako katalyzátor ransomwarových útoků, ale i jako jejich brzda. Hybridní již nejsou pouze cloudy, ale i sítě. Westcom 3D LAB demonstruje možnosti integrace bezpečnostních řešení více dodavatelů. Velké jazykové modely by mohly samy pro sebe generovat programy. A k čemu to může být dobré? Povede umělá inteligence k modernizaci finančních služeb?
articles.title: Týden na ITBiz: Hybridní již nejsou pouze cloudy, ale i sítě

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Ucelený přehled článků, zpráviček a diskusí za minulých 7 dní.
articles.title: Událo se v týdnu 33/2024

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Nový model umělé inteligence odhaluje skrytý jazyk DNA. Antropický princip a problém srovnávání nekonečen. Čeští vědci jako první viděli 3D strukturu organického materiálu staršího než Země.
articles.title: Týden na ScienceMag.cz: Gravitační vlny by dokázaly prozradit používání warpových pohonů

articles.author: Reklama
articles.description: Ať už horečně hledáte levnou cestu k postavení hového počítače, nebo jen chcete upgradovat stárnoucí kopii Office, tato kolekce nabídky od Goodoffer24.com vám pomůže. Jejich ceny jsou opravdu neuvěřitelné, tak na co čekat?
articles.title: Oficiální cena za Windows 11 Pro je €259 avšak Goodoffer24 účtuje jen €20

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Přehled červencových vydání Jaderných novin: stav vydání jádra, citáty týdne a seznam článků týkajících se jádra.
articles.title: Jaderné noviny – přehled za červenec 2024

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Řízení rizik může zpomalovat inovace, včetně zavádění AI. Konica Minolta se zaměřila na ochranu firemních dat. Teplotu elektroniky by mohly měřit neutrony, přesně a rychle. Nekonečně velká ochrana stojí nekonečně velké peníze. Průzkum Acronis hlásí 293% nárůst e-mailových útoků.
articles.title: Týden na ITBiz: Teplotu elektroniky by mohly měřit neutrony, přesně a rychle

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Ucelený přehled článků, zpráviček a diskusí za minulých 7 dní.
articles.title: Událo se v týdnu 32/2024

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Jak umělá inteligence pomáhá s průzkumem Marsu. Při zapamatování a vybavování se mozkové vlny šíří opačným směrem. Průlom ve vývoji ultrarychlých luminiscenčních materiálů. Kvantové tornádo má zlepšit naše chápání černých děr.
articles.title: Týden na ScienceMag.cz: Data z CERNu dále omezují podmínky pro dlouho žijící supersymetrické částice

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Energetika a vodárenství zaznamenaly čtyřnásobné zvýšení průměrných nákladů na obnovu po ransomwaru. Technologie baterií (5): Vědci znovu zkusili baterie s vodou jako elektrolytem. Kam se v AddAI posunuli a kam směřují. Ness představuje Matrix, nástroj na efektivní agilní vývoj. Gordic představil nástroj pro signalizaci rizik u podepisovaných elektronických dokumentů.
articles.title: Týden na ITBiz: Energetika a vodárenství zaznamenaly čtyřnásobné zvýšení průměrných nákladů na obnovu po ransomwaru

articles.description: Bylo oznámeno (Mastodon, 𝕏) zmrazení řetězců (string freeze) pro GIMP 3.0.0.
articles.title: Zmrazení řetězců pro GIMP 3.0.0

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Národní úřad pro kybernetickou a informační bezpečnost (NÚKIB) a Úřad pro ochranu osobních údajů (ÚOOÚ) vydali společné prohlášení upozorňující na e-shopové aplikace, které požadují nestandardní oprávnění v zařízení uživatele a mohou sbírat nadměrné množství uživatelských dat včetně osobních údajů.
articles.title: Společné prohlášení NÚKIB a ÚOOÚ k e-shopovým aplikacím

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Byl publikován trailer (YouTube) k open source počítačové hře, realtimové strategii, Beyond All Reason (Wikipedie). Zdrojové kódy Beyond All Reason, zkráceně BAR, jsou k dispozici na GitHubu.
articles.title: Trailer k open source počítačové hře Beyond All Reason

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Společnost AMD kupuje firmu ZT Systems, tj. předního poskytovatele infrastruktury pro umělou inteligenci, za 4,9 miliardy dolarů.
articles.title: Společnost AMD kupuje firmu ZT Systems

articles.description:
Nová čísla časopisů od nakladatelství Raspberry Pi:
MagPi 144 (pdf) a
HackSpace 81 (pdf). Samostatný HackSpace číslem 81 skončil. Stane se součástí časopisu MagPi.
articles.title: MagPi 144 a HackSpace 81

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Před 4 roky byla počítačová hra Factorio (Wikipedie), oficiálně běžící také na Linuxu, vydána ve verzi 1.0. Vydání verze 2.0 a velkého vesmírného rozšíření Factorio: Space Age je plánováno na 21. října 2024. Těšit se lze mimo jiné na pětinožce viz Friday Facts #424 (YouTube).
articles.title: Factorio 2.0 a Factorio: Space Age

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Texmaker (Wikipedie), tj. svobodný multiplatformní editor pro psaní dokumentů v LaTeXu, byl vydán ve verzi 6.0.0 (Bluesky). Přehled novinek v ChangeLogu.
articles.title: Texmaker 6.0.0

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Na čem aktuálně pracují vývojáři GNOME a KDE? Pravidelný přehled novinek v Týden v GNOME a Týden v KDE.
articles.title: Týden v GNOME a Týden v KDE (16. srpna 2024)

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Debian slaví 31 let. Ian Murdock oznámil vydání "Debian Linux Release" 16. srpna 1993.
articles.title: Debian slaví 31 let

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Building off the prior NVIDIA 560 beta driver releases, the NVIDIA 560.35.03 stable Linux driver was released today for providing the latest official NVIDIA graphics/compute support for Linux systems...
articles.title: NVIDIA 560.35.03 Linux Driver Released With More Wayland Fixes

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Google engineer Qais Yousef has posted a set of 16 patches for the "Schedutil" scheduler utilization code within the Linux kernel to better manage system response time. Schedutil is often used by default on many Linux distributions and with these patches a popular web browser benchmark can be as much as 30% faster with these kernel patches...
articles.title: Experimental Schedutil Patches Yield 30% Boost To Web Browser Benchmark On Linux

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Following all of the Snapdragon X1 upstream enablement work over the past number of months by Qualcomm and then DeviceTree additions emerging for enabling the likes of the ASUS Vivobook S 15, Lenovo Yoga Slim 7x, Lenovo ThinkPad T14s Gen 6, and Microsoft Surface 7, the Samsung Galaxy Book4 Edge is the newest Snapdragon X1 Elite laptop seeing Linux DT support...
articles.title: Linux Support Emerging For The Samsung Galaxy Book4 Edge X1 Elite Laptop

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Zed, the code/text editor being developed by former Atom editor developers, has continued to gain interest among developers since going open-source, being written in the Rust programming language, and native Linux builds taking shape. The latest feature work on Zed is beginning to integrate AI-powered functionality by leveraging Anthropic's Claude LLM...
articles.title: Zed Code Editor Begins Adding AI Features Powered By Anthropic's Claude

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: SVT-AV1 2.2 is now available for this leading open-source AV1 video encoder. With this new version comes yet more performance optimizations...
articles.title: SVT-AV1 2.2 Delivers More Performance Improvements

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Released last month was the VirtualBox 7.1 Beta 1 virtualization software release from Oracle. This new version is bringing a modernized GUI, Wayland clipboard sharing, and other improvements. Released yesterday was the second beta of this big VirtualBox update...
articles.title: VirtualBox 7.1 Beta 2 Released For This Big Oracle Virtualization Update

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Today marks the beginning of the string freeze for the long-awaited GIMP 3.0 open-source image editor release as one of the leading free software alternatives to Adobe Photoshop...
articles.title: GIMP 3.0 Enters String Freeze, Inching Closer To Release

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Andrea della Porta of SUSE has been working on upstreaming the Linux kernel support to boot the Raspberry Pi 5 on a mainline kernel. Over the past few months Andrea has posted a number of different patches derived in part from Raspberry Pi's downstream kernel code. The latest effort being pursued by the SUSE engineer is on upstreaming Raspberry Pi RP1 PCI device support using a DeviceTree overlay...
articles.title: Linux Patches Work To Upstream Raspberry Pi's RP1 PCI Device Support

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: As part of my ongoing AMD Ryzen 9 9950X Linux testing, last week I provided a look at the AVX-512 benefits to Zen 5 and also the Windows vs. Linux performance for the Ryzen 9 9950X. For sharing today is a look at multiple Linux distributions up and running on the AMD Ryzen 9 9950X (Zen 5) desktop. Among the distributions in the mix are Intel's Clear Linux distribution that is optimally tuned for maximum x86_64 Linux performance and once again even on AMD hardware shows the significant benefits to a well-tuned Linux software stack.
articles.title: Intel Continues To Show AMD The Importance Of Software Optimizations: 16% More Ryzen 9 9950X Performance

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Queued yesterday into the Linux power management subsystem's "linux-next" branch ahead of the Linux 6.12 kernel are some important additions for Intel processors and also an important fix for AMD processors to enjoy package power monitoring...
articles.title: Granite Rapids Idle/P-State Work For Linux 6.12 & An Important AMD Energy Reporting Fix

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: While the Unigine SDK these days is more known for its simulation and engineering offerings rather than as a game engine, this engine remains visually impressive and continues advancing. Unigine 2.19 has been released that brings a number of improvements to the engine and leaves us clamoring to see a new/updated benchmark...
articles.title: Unigine 2.19 Rolls Out OpenXR Support, Multi-Threaded Renderer

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: There are a few interesting bits of information as part of this week's updates from the Ubuntu Desktop Team Integration Squad...
articles.title: Ubuntu Fixes Old NVIDIA Wayland Support For GNOME, Hiring More Desktop Engineers

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: LunarG engineer Aitor Camacho Larrondo has proposed VK_EXT_external_memory_metal, a new extension for the Vulkan API to allow for more easily sharing memory objects from Vulkan with Apple's Metal...
articles.title: Proposed Vulkan Extension To Improve Memory Sharing With Apple's Metal

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: A new batch of HID subsystem fixes were merged today for the ongoing Linux 6.11 kernel development...
articles.title: ASUS ROG Ally X & GT7868Q See HID Fixes With Linux 6.11

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: The FreeBSD open-source operating system project published their Q2'2024 status report that outlines some interesting work happening to this leading BSD project...
articles.title: AMD & FreeBSD Begin Collaborating Over OS Improvements

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: NVIDIA recently sent over their RTX 2000 Ada Generation and RTX 4000 Ada Generation graphics cards suited for designers, engineers, and creative professionals. In my testing the past several weeks these professional graphics cards have been working out with NVIDIA's Linux driver stack -- including their open-source kernel modules now the default with the R555 driver series and later. While there is that previous article looking at how their open-source kernel drivers are at parity to the former proprietary kernel modules, today's article is looking at how the NVIDIA RTX 2000/4000 Ada Generation performance stacks up against the AMD Radeon Pro competition.
articles.title: NVIDIA RTX 2000 & RTX 4000 Ada Generation Linux Performance

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Red Hat engineer Jan Grulich has provided an update today on PipeWire camera handling with the upcoming Fedora 41 release...
articles.title: Fedora 41 To Rely On PipeWire By Default For Firefox Camera Handling

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: GameMode as the open-source daemon from Feral Interactive to optimize Linux system performance on-demand when running games is out with its first release of 2024...
articles.title: Feral's GameMode 1.8.2 Fixes Hybrid CPU Core Pinning

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: If you are picking up one of the new AMD Ryzen 9000 series desktop processors soon for Linux use, you may be wondering whether it's worthwhile or even necessary moving to the latest Linux kernel code compared to the likes of Ubuntu 24.04 LTS that are shipping a Linux 6.8 derived kernel. Here are some quick benchmarks in looking at that question...
articles.title: Linux 6.11 Kernel Performance On The AMD Ryzen 9 9000 Series

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: To date the Raspberry Pi 5 single board computer has been offered with either 4GB or 8GB of system memory. The Raspberry Pi 5 4GB has retailed for $60 USD while the Raspberry Pi 5 8GB at $80 USD. For those needing something a little cheaper and not needing as much system memory, the Raspberry Pi 5 2GB model launched today...
articles.title: Raspberry Pi 5 2GB Launches At $50 USD

articles.author: Michael Larabel

articles.title: AMD Acquiring Another Company To Bolster Its AI Play

articles.title: Linux 6.11-rc4 Released: "Nothing Feels All That Odd"

articles.author: Michael Larabel

articles.title: Arch Linux Based CachyOS Switches To Open NVIDIA Kernel Modules, COSMIC Desktop Option

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: While Linus Torvalds was hoping to merge the sched_ext extensible scheduler for the Linux v6.11 kernel cycle, that didn't end up happening after some technical issues were raised on the kernel mailing list. Since then though the kernel developers have been collaborating and given the latest sched_ext patches with "for-next" and "for-6.12" markings, it's looking like the extensible scheduler will be attempted again for the Linux 6.12 merge window...
articles.title: It's Looking Like sched_ext Will Try Again To Land For Linux 6.12

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Ahead of the Linux 6.11-rc4 kernel release coming up later today, some more Bcachefs file-system patches were merged this weekend for this experimental copy-on-write file-system...
articles.title: Bcachefs Merges New On-Disk Format Version For Linux 6.11, Working Toward Defrag

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Faith Ekstrand has merged another two dozen patches for the open-source NVIDIA "NVK" Vulkan driver with next quarter's Mesa 24.3...

ESL FaceIt Group (EFG) and Blizzard Entertainment have announced that the Overwatch Champions Series (OWCS) is bringing its World Finals to DreamHack Stockholm 2024. The event will take place between November 22 and 24, 2024, and is the first major in-person event for the esports league in years. 


During the OWCS World Finals, eight of the world's best teams will battle it out to see who is the best Overwatch 2 group while fans can enjoy watching the physical event and exploring the lifestyle gaming festival over the course of three days. Of course, there will be much more than the tournament for Overwatch 2 fans to enjoy, with various physical activations to keep fans busy in addition to everything Stockholm's first-ever DreamHack festival has to offer. 


Live Overwatch 2 and a gaming …

articles.author: Arka Sarkar
articles.description:
Playground Games has announced a brand new game mode in Forza Horizon 5. Titled Hide and Seek, this mode will pit five "Seekers" against one "Hider", who will do their utmost to escape the pursuit.


The trailer marked the beginning of Xbox's Gamescom 2024 livestream. Coming September 10, Hide and Seek will be available as a free update for all. While the core gameplay will be based very much on the childhood activity we all participated in, there will be a few adaptations.


You'll have to make strategic calls in Forza Horizon 5's Hide and Seek mode


In Hide and Seek, you can't just outrun your Seekers if you become a Hider. A special meter will be available at the bottom of your screen, and as the gauge fills up, you can camouflage yourself. As a result, you can even hide in the open and make a fool out of those pursuing you.




But beware: drive too close, and the hiders can ping your location. This will help them track you down before approaching the Endzone. From what I understood, the Endzone will be visible as a bright-orange location, but it will take time to activate. While hiding might be the right choice in certain situations, be ready to run when required.


Forza Horizon 5, released in 2021, continues to get more content in festivals and seasons. I am more than intrigued to try out Hide and Seek when it goes live on September 10, 2024. The mode will also have its own reward track, which will include XP from the games you play. Playing continuously will also help you to unlock a play streak and get bonus XP as well. 

The post Forza Horizon 5 will let you play Hide and Seek with cars this September appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Forza Horizon 5 will let you play Hide and Seek with cars this September

articles.author: Zoey Handley
articles.description:
Windup Games, a studio founded mainly by industry veterans and former staff from Coldwood Interactive (Unravel, Unravel Two), has revealed its debut game, Hela. It’s an open-world adventure involving mice; it’s coming to PC and consoles, and it’s the best thing I’ve seen this morning.


The trailer shows off two mice trying to figure out some sort of puzzle involving a hanging pair of eyeglasses while not waking a cat. They hold their breath as a rolling washer makes potentially cat-rousing levels of noise. When the cat doesn’t stir, balls of light waft in through the window. They get focused into one ball by the glasses, and then the mice stuff it into a jar. Take that, magic.




Then, it cuts to the good stuff: the gameplay. The mice swing around like Spider-man in a big yard using woolen tongues that shoot out from their frog-shaped backpacks. They then glide around by filling their backpacks with hot air or something. There’s foraging for mushrooms, giant bunnies, and some good-old cooperative gameplay.


It looks a bit rough in a low-budget Unreal Engine 5 kind of way, but the gameplay looks bewilderingly enjoyable. The press release describes it as “heartwarming,” but I think it looks rad. If you get to ride a paper boat down a stream, I’m going to lose my mind.


Hela doesn’t have a stated release date and is said to be coming to PC and consoles.

The post Hela, a new game from Unravel creators, features mice with frog backpacks appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Hela, a new game from Unravel creators, features mice with frog backpacks

articles.author: Franklin Bellone Borges
articles.description:
As part of the Kickstart Quests for Fortnite Chapter 5 Season 4, players are tasked with finding and accepting a Shadow Briefing: Armory, a new type of briefing that debuted together with Absolute Doom. 


But although they can be accepted by interacting with set stations within the Island, finding the latter when in the heat of battle can be tricky. To help you complete the quest and get a welcome amount of XP, here are all Shadow Briefing: Armory locations in Fortnite.


All Shadow Briefing Armory locations in Fortnite


As you can see by choosing to track the kickstart quest, you can find a total of three Shadow Briefing: Armory stations in Fortnite, with one being located on Doomstadt, while the other two can be found on The Raft and Castle Doom. After accepting any of them, you will b…

There's a new way to collect free Primogems, as Hoyoverse just added more third-party integration to Genshin Impact accounts. If you use Discord, you can now link your Discord and HoYo accounts to earn in-game rewards.

What does linking Genshin Impact and Discord do?

articles.author: Zeeshan Khan
articles.description:
Age of Empires Mobile is an exciting new game from TiMi Studios, based on the beloved Age of Empires franchise. There are forty historical heroes that are scheduled to appear, including Rani Durgavati and Julius Caesar. Basically, it's an RTS, where you will construct buildings, gather resources, and expand the empire.


This article will provide key details of Age of Empires Mobile, such as the release date, how to pre-register, and pre-registration rewards.


Age of Empire Mobile release date


Age of Empire Mobile is officially making its debut on October 17, 2024, on Android and iOS. However, the developers did not mention the availability of regions and countries at the time of launch.


How to pre-register for Age of Empires Mobile?




There are two ways to pre-register Ages of Empire Mobile. Don't worry; we will discuss both ways. The first one is very simple; simply head to the App Store or Google Play Store page, depending on your device, and click on the "Pre-register/Pre-order" button to pre-register yourself.


In case you can't see the pre-registration page, then simply head to the official website and click on "Pre-register" button. A window will pop up asking for your email address. Just fill in the details, and you will sign up for the launch.


Age of Empires Mobile pre-registration rewards


There are various rewards that are provided once you pre-register for the game. Here are the list of items:



Wood x150


Food x150


Stone x150


Gold x150


Building Speed-Up x1h


Research Speed-Up x1h


Training Speed-Up x1h


Legendary Arrival Recruitment Token x2


Empire Coins x1K


Special Frame


Hero: Cleopatra VII


The post When will Age of Empires Mobile launch? appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: When will Age of Empires Mobile launch?

Every one of its abilities charges up a meter that can be used to summon a spooky death-like visage that deals massive amounts of damage to enemies and looks glorious. Provided you're the one controlling it. 


The Lotus Eaters is a short narrative quest for players who have completed the Whispers in the Wall quest. In it, you'll reunite with a familiar character and set up the events leading to Warframe: 1999, whe…

articles.author: Madison Benson
articles.description:
With any online video game, there are bound to be some errors and bugs, especially after a major update. Disney Dreamlight Valley is no exception, and the emergence of a new issue, Initialization Error 6, is causing some players to miss out on exploring newly added quests and characters. Here's how to fix this error.


Initialization Error 6 fix in Disney Dreamlight Valley


While Initialization Error 6 is hitting at a seemingly random time for some players, one potential culprit is the Reflection of China House Style. Using this as your house can cause this error to occur with no way to reverse it. In other cases, it may have hit at a completely random time without any apparent causes.




Fortunately, Gameloft, the team behind Disney Dreamlight Valley, is aware of this bug and is working on a fix for it. While there's no current solution at this moment, we can anticipate one arriving either on August 21, 2024, or shortly after. If Initialization Error 6 appears again after this date, Gameloft will likely reinvestigate the problem and release another hotfix.


In the meantime, you can try the following tips to resolve or work past the issue:



Restart your game.


Redownload Disney Dreamlight Valley.


Play Disney Dreamlight Valley on another platform.


Removing the Reflection of China House Style temporarily if you manage to get in-game again.



While these aren't guaranteed to fix the error, they may help temporarily remove it until Gameloft implements a permanent patch. There's no exact timeline for when a hotfix will be released, but the team has listed it as a top-priority bug, so we can expect a patch pretty soon.

The post How to fix Initialization Error 6 in Disney Dreamlight Valley appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: How to fix Initialization Error 6 in Disney Dreamlight Valley

articles.author: Madison Benson
articles.description:
Throughout your time in Disney Dreamlight Valley's Rift in Time expansion, you'll need bamboo for quests, cooking recipes, and furniture crafting. However, unlike other resources that you can grow, bamboo has a specific spawn location and growing condition.


Bamboo location in Disney Dreamlight Valley


You can find bamboo anywhere in the Wild Tangle as part of Disney Dreamlight Valley's Rift in Time expansion. Rather than planting and growing seeds, you can forage them like you would any herb in the base game. It'll randomly and periodically sprout out of the ground, allowing you to quickly harvest it each day without spending money on seeds.


Screenshot by Destructoid


However, this also means you can't just grow and harvest dozens of bamboo at a time. You'll typically find between 5-10 at one time around the Wild Tangle, meaning you'll need to revisit the location multiple times throughout the day if you need several.


How to use bamboo in Disney Dreamlight Valley


You'll mainly use bamboo for quests, cooking recipes, and furniture crafting. While you won't need it for any base game missions, A Rift in Time's story quest line asks for it occasionally, particularly in its third act.


Alongside this, you'll need it for the following cooking recipes:



Piquant Piranha Soup: Bamboo, Chili Pepper, Piranha


Braised Bamboo Shoots: Bamboo, Canola, Ginger, Soya



Lastly, you can create bamboo items at your crafting workbench. You can make items like bamboo shoots, benches, and walls, among other options, to turn your house into a beach resort if you'd like. I haven't tried doing this yet, but it could be a fun little project for the future.

The post How to get bamboo in Disney Dreamlight Valley appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: How to get bamboo in Disney Dreamlight Valley

Note that only those who lost their job due to layoffs, not because they were fired or asked to leave a company for other reasons, can claim a copy of the game. It's difficult to keep track, but this campai…
